What is the average claim amount for aut: SELECT AVG(estimated_damage) as avg_claim_amount, COUNT(*) as total_claims FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE claim_type = 'Auto Collision'
Show me all claims for a specific policy: SELECT TOP 10 claim_id, claim_type, estimated_damage, amount_paid, claim_date, status, fraud_flag FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE policy_number LIKE 'POL-2024-%' ORDER BY claim_date DESC
What is the fraud rate in California?: SELECT state, AVG(fraud_rate) as avg_fraud_rate, SUM(total_claims) as total_claims FROM dbo.regional_statistics WHERE state = 'CA' GROUP BY state
Find all high-risk claimants with risk s: SELECT claimant_id, name, risk_score, claim_frequency, credit_score, driving_record, total_claims_count FROM dbo.claimant_profiles WHERE risk_score > 70 ORDER BY risk_score DESC
How does a $15,000 auto claim compare to: SELECT city, avg_claim_amount, 15000 as submitted_claim, (15000 - avg_claim_amount) as difference, CASE WHEN 15000 > avg_claim_amount * 1.5 THEN 'ABOVE AVERAGE' WHEN 15000 < avg_claim_amount * 0.5 THEN 'BELOW AVERAGE' ELSE 'WITHIN NORMAL RANGE' END as assessment FROM dbo.regional_statistics WHERE state = 'FL' AND city = 'Miami'
Show fraud indicators for claims with ex: SELECT TOP 10 indicator_id, claim_id, indicator_type, severity, detected_date, pattern_description, investigation_status FROM dbo.fraud_indicators WHERE indicator_type = 'Excessive Claim Amount' ORDER BY severity DESC
Which policies have the most claims?: SELECT TOP 10 policy_number, policy_type, total_claims, total_amount_paid, claims_trend, fraud_claims_count FROM dbo.policy_claims_summary ORDER BY total_claims DESC
What are the top fraud patterns detected: SELECT indicator_type, COUNT(*) as occurrence_count, COUNT(CASE WHEN severity = 'CRITICAL' THEN 1 END) as critical_count, COUNT(CASE WHEN investigation_status = 'CONFIRMED' THEN 1 END) as confirmed_count FROM dbo.fraud_indicators GROUP BY indicator_type ORDER BY occurrence_count DESC
Show claims history for a specific claim: SELECT TOP 10 claim_id, claim_type, estimated_damage, claim_date, status, fraud_flag FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE claimant_name LIKE '%Smith%' ORDER BY claim_date DESC
What is the claim frequency by state?: SELECT state, SUM(total_claims) as total_claims, AVG(claim_frequency) as avg_frequency_per_1000, AVG(fraud_rate) as avg_fraud_rate FROM dbo.regional_statistics GROUP BY state ORDER BY total_claims DESC
Find all claims with missing documentati: SELECT TOP 20 claim_id, claimant_name, claim_type, estimated_damage, police_report, photos_provided, witness_statements FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE police_report = 0 OR photos_provided = 0 ORDER BY estimated_damage DESC
Show policies with increasing claim tren: SELECT policy_number, policy_type, total_claims, total_amount_paid, avg_claim_amount, first_claim_date, last_claim_date FROM dbo.policy_claims_summary WHERE claims_trend = 'INCREASING' ORDER BY total_amount_paid DESC
What is the average claim amount by vehi: SELECT TOP 15 vehicle_make, COUNT(*) as claim_count, AVG(estimated_damage) as avg_damage, SUM(CASE WHEN fraud_flag = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as fraud_count FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE vehicle_make IS NOT NULL GROUP BY vehicle_make ORDER BY claim_count DESC
Find open fraud investigations with high: SELECT fi.claim_id, fi.indicator_type, fi.severity, fi.detected_date, ch.claimant_name, ch.estimated_damage, ch.claim_type FROM dbo.fraud_indicators fi JOIN dbo.claims_history ch ON fi.claim_id = ch.claim_id WHERE fi.investigation_status = 'OPEN' AND fi.severity IN ('HIGH', 'CRITICAL') ORDER BY fi.detected_date DESC
What percentage of claims in Texas are f: SELECT state, COUNT(*) as total_claims, SUM(CASE WHEN fraud_flag = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as fraud_flagged, ROUND(CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN fraud_flag = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS FLOAT) / COUNT(*) * 100, 2) as fraud_percentage FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE state = 'TX' GROUP BY state
Show the risk profile for a claimant: SELECT claimant_id, name, age, state, city, customer_since, total_claims_count, total_claims_amount, risk_score, claim_frequency, credit_score, driving_record, account_status FROM dbo.claimant_profiles WHERE claimant_id = 'CLM-001'
Which cities have the highest fraud rate: SELECT TOP 10 city, state, fraud_rate, total_claims, avg_claim_amount FROM dbo.regional_statistics WHERE total_claims > 50 ORDER BY fraud_rate DESC
Find recent high-value claims: SELECT TOP 20 claim_id, claimant_name, claim_type, estimated_damage, claim_date, status, state, fraud_flag FROM dbo.claims_history WHERE estimated_damage > 10000 ORDER BY claim_date DESC
What is the total amount paid out by pol: SELECT policy_type, COUNT(*) as policy_count, SUM(total_amount_paid) as total_paid, AVG(total_amount_paid) as avg_paid_per_policy, SUM(fraud_claims_count) as total_fraud_claims FROM dbo.policy_claims_summary GROUP BY policy_type ORDER BY total_paid DESC
Show customers with poor driving records: SELECT claimant_id, name, risk_score, driving_record, claim_frequency, total_claims_count, total_claims_amount, credit_score FROM dbo.claimant_profiles WHERE driving_record = 'major_violations' AND claim_frequency IN ('high', 'very_high') ORDER BY risk_score DESC
